data.title: Penn Badgley Was Pranked By Gossip Girl Co-Star Blake Lively
data.meta_description: Speaking on his 'Podcrushed' podcast, Penn Badgley recalled a "remarkable" prank pulled Blake Lively during the height of 'Gossip Girl.'
data.text:
Blake Lively has a long history of pulling pranks on her nearest and dearest, including her former Gossip Girl co-star Penn Badgley.

On a recent episode of his Podcrushed podcast, Badgley recalled one of her “remarkable prank[s],” in which she convinced him that Aerosmith frontman Steven Tyler was his father.

“I cannot muster a single eff to give about pranks. I actually really admire people who do,” the actor told his podcast co-hosts, Nava Kavelin and Sophie Ansari. “Somebody who may or may not be known for this — Blake Lively is, as I recall, very serious about pranks.”

The prank occurred during the height of their Gossip Girl days. “I get an email, just like, ‘There’s this press item that we’re trying to kill, but just so you know, somebody thinks or Steve Tyler thinks he’s your dad,’” he said.

Lively apparently got his manager, publicist, and mother in on the joke, and convinced Badgley to call his mom and ask about the situation.

“My mom is so not an actress, so not a prankster either, and she’s upset,” he continued. “I’m like, ‘Mom why are you upset?!’ And then she takes a pause, that is like, the pause that sold me, and she goes, ‘Why do you think we moved out of Maryland?’”

After being left “speechless” for a few seconds, he soon realized what day it was. “Ah, f****** April Fools,” Badgley recalls saying in the moment, adding that Lively “couldn’t keep a straight face” when the truth finally dawned on him.
